summary: States and territories can use isolation and quarantine to keep people from spreading infectious diseases—as they did in the COVID-19 pandemic. It's easier to do this in the early stages of an emergency if a jurisdiction has a plan in place. The Department of Health and Human Services is supposed to help jurisdictions prepare for and respond to emergencies by providing guidance and funding. But...
title: Public Health Preparedness: HHS Should Assess Jurisdictional Planning for Isolation and Quarantine
